member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Builder.IISServerOptions.ForwardWindowsAuthentication
member.summary: Used to indicate if the authentication handler should be registered. This is only done if ANCM indicates IIS has a non-anonymous authentication enabled, or for back compat with ANCMs that did not provide this information.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Builder.IISServerOptions.MaxRequestBodySize
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum allowed size of any request body in bytes. When set to null, the maximum request length will not be restricted in ASP.NET Core. However, the IIS maxAllowedContentLength will still restrict content length requests (30,000,000 by default). This limit has no effect on upgraded connections which are always unlimited. This can be overridden per-request via .

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpSys.Internal.RequestUriBuilder.DecodeCore(System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32,System.Span{System.Byte})
member.summary: Unescape the percent-encodings
member.param: The iterator point to the first % char

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpSys.Internal.RequestUriBuilder.UnescapePercentEncoding(System.Int32@,System.Int32,System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Byte})
member.summary:
Read the percent-encoding and try unescape it.
The operation first peek at the character the iterator points at. If it is % the is then moved on to scan the following to characters. If the two following characters are hexadecimal literals they will be unescaped and the value will be returned.
If the first character is not % the iterator will be removed beyond the location of % and -1 will be returned.
If the following two characters can't be successfully unescaped the iterator will be move behind the % and -1 will be returned.
member.returns: The unescaped byte if success. Otherwise return -1.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.HttpSys.Internal.RequestUriBuilder.ReadHex(System.Int32@,System.Int32,System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Byte})
member.summary:
Read the next char and convert it into hexadecimal value.
The iterator will be moved to the next byte no matter no matter whether the operation successes.
member.returns: The hexadecimal value if successes, otherwise -1.

member.name: T:StartupHook
member.summary: Startup hooks are pieces of code that will run before a users program main executes See: https://github.com/dotnet/core-setup/blob/master/Documentation/design-docs/host-startup-hook.md The type must be named StartupHook without any namespace, and should be internal.

member.name: T:System.Buffers.DiagnosticMemoryPool
member.summary: Used to allocate and distribute re-usable blocks of memory.

member.name: F:System.Buffers.DiagnosticMemoryPool.AnySize
member.summary: This default value passed in to Rent to use the default value for the pool.

member.name: T:System.Buffers.DiagnosticPoolBlock
member.summary: Block tracking object used by the byte buffer memory pool. A slab is a large allocation which is divided into smaller blocks. The individual blocks are then treated as independent array segments.

member.name: F:System.Buffers.DiagnosticPoolBlock._pool
member.summary: Back-reference to the memory pool which this block was allocated from. It may only be returned to this pool.

member.name: M:System.Buffers.DiagnosticPoolBlock.#ctor(System.Buffers.DiagnosticMemoryPool,System.Buffers.IMemoryOwner{System.Byte})
member.summary: This object cannot be instantiated outside of the static Create method

member.name: T:System.Buffers.MemoryPoolBlock
member.summary: Wraps an array allocated in the pinned object heap in a reusable block of managed memory

member.name: P:System.Buffers.MemoryPoolBlock.Pool
member.summary: Back-reference to the memory pool which this block was allocated from. It may only be returned to this pool.

member.name: T:System.Buffers.PinnedBlockMemoryPool
member.summary: Used to allocate and distribute re-usable blocks of memory.

member.name: F:System.Buffers.PinnedBlockMemoryPool._blockSize
member.summary: The size of a block. 4096 is chosen because most operating systems use 4k pages.

member.name: P:System.Buffers.PinnedBlockMemoryPool.MaxBufferSize
member.summary: Max allocation block size for pooled blocks, larger values can be leased but they will be disposed after use rather than returned to the pool.

member.name: P:System.Buffers.PinnedBlockMemoryPool.BlockSize
member.summary: The size of a block. 4096 is chosen because most operating systems use 4k pages.

member.name: F:System.Buffers.PinnedBlockMemoryPool._blocks
member.summary: Thread-safe collection of blocks which are currently in the pool. A slab will pre-allocate all of the block tracking objects and add them to this collection. When memory is requested it is taken from here first, and when it is returned it is re-added.

member.name: F:System.Buffers.PinnedBlockMemoryPool._isDisposed
member.summary: This is part of implementing the IDisposable pattern.

member.name: F:System.Buffers.PinnedBlockMemoryPool.AnySize
member.summary: This default value passed in to Rent to use the default value for the pool.

member.name: M:System.Buffers.PinnedBlockMemoryPool.Return(System.Buffers.MemoryPoolBlock)
member.summary: Called to return a block to the pool. Once Return has been called the memory no longer belongs to the caller, and Very Bad Things will happen if the memory is read of modified subsequently. If a caller fails to call Return and the block tracking object is garbage collected, the block tracking object's finalizer will automatically re-create and return a new tracking object into the pool. This will only happen if there is a bug in the server, however it is necessary to avoid leaving "dead zones" in the slab due to lost block tracking objects.
member.param: The block to return. It must have been acquired by calling Lease on the same memory pool instance.

member.name: T:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskToApm
member.summary: Provides support for efficiently using Tasks to implement the APM (Begin/End) pattern.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskToApm.Begin(System.Threading.Tasks.Task,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Marshals the Task as an IAsyncResult, using the supplied callback and state to implement the APM pattern.
member.param: The callback to be invoked upon completion.
The state to be stored in the IAsyncResult.
member.returns: An IAsyncResult to represent the task's asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskToApm.End(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Processes an IAsyncResult returned by Begin.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskToApm.End``1(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Processes an IAsyncResult returned by Begin.

member.name: T:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskToApm.TaskAsyncResult
member.summary: Provides a simple IAsyncResult that wraps a Task.
member.remarks: We could use the Task as the IAsyncResult if the Task's AsyncState is the same as the object state, but that's very rare, in particular in a situation where someone cares about allocation, and always using TaskAsyncResult simplifies things and enables additional optimizations.

member.name: F:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskToApm.TaskAsyncResult._task
member.summary: The wrapped Task.

member.name: F:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskToApm.TaskAsyncResult._callback
member.summary: Callback to invoke when the wrapped task completes.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskToApm.TaskAsyncResult.#ctor(System.Threading.Tasks.Task,System.Object,System.AsyncCallback)
member.summary: Initializes the IAsyncResult with the Task to wrap and the associated object state.
member.param: Callback to invoke when the wrapped task completes.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskToApm.TaskAsyncResult.InvokeCallback
member.summary: Invokes the callback.

member.name: P:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskToApm.TaskAsyncResult.AsyncState
member.summary: Gets a user-defined object that qualifies or contains information about an asynchronous operation.

member.name: P:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskToApm.TaskAsyncResult.CompletedSynchronously
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the asynchronous operation completed synchronously.
member.remarks: This is set lazily based on whether the has completed by the time this object is created.

member.name: P:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskToApm.TaskAsyncResult.IsCompleted
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the asynchronous operation has completed.

member.name: P:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskToApm.TaskAsyncResult.AsyncWaitHandle
member.summary: Gets a that is used to wait for an asynchronous operation to complete.
